channel.title: Rolling Roland - Bicycling to Work in Vancouver
channel.description: Recent content on Rolling Roland - Bicycling to Work in Vancouver

item.title: Please Do Not Run on the Road
item.description: I know there is less traffic but but please don’t run on the road. All it takes is one car at 50km/h to kill a runner. If you are going to run on the road wear lights and don’t wear headphones!

item.title: Bicycle 10 metres Apart During the Pandemic?!?
item.description: 10 metres apart? Now that is going to be difficult.

item.title: Garmin Varia Rtl510 Radar Works
item.description: Bought the Varia RTL 510 Radar and an Edge 130 computer a couple of weeks ago. Works great! Now I want a colour Garmin computer! Can’t wait until there is competition and other companies support radar!

item.title: Is It Me or Are Car Drivers Driving More Badly?
item.description:
• Besides the usual:
    • turning left on a red (if the light is yellow then you are not supposed to enter an intersection folks!)
    • not stopping at a stop sign

item.title: Reluctant Road Bicyclist
item.description: I’ve purchased an All City “cross bike” and become a reluctant :-) road bicyclist! Super fun but super dangerous due to people driving cars badly and potholes! Also clip in pedals are more efficient but super impractical for normal city riding #ymmv

item.title: day 36 of snowmaggedon2016-17
item.description: tl;dr: Snowmaggedon Day 36 (since December 5th, 2016) means no bicycling to work for me in the last 5 weeks :-(

item.title: Full vancouver >5 degrees raingear
item.description: tl;dr: If it’s raining and over 5 degrees, I wear: crocs, maloja waterproof bicycling shorts (with wicking underwear), gloves, Dish and Duer rain shield vest. If it’s raining hard I add a happy days rain cape .

item.title: Do you really need to wear socks when bicycling to work in the rain?
item.description: tl;dr: My thesis is:NO you don’t have to wear socks when bicycling to work in the rain if your commute is less than 10 km one way and it’s >= about 5 degrees Celsius

item.title: mobi bikes after a few months
item.description: Mobi bikes are very useful for me but still not generally useful until they make it to Broadway and Commercial and we could do with less clunky bikes and get rid of those helmets.

item.title: Every week is bike to work week
item.description: Buy the right gear and lights and every week is bike to work week!

item.title: hello
item.description: I’ve been bicycling to work for 9 years in the city of Vancouver, BC and this is my bicycling blog. I’m not a vehicular bicyclist or a mountain biker or a road biker. Just someone with a lovely (mostly!) 6km commute Monday to Friday from East Van to Gastown.
